full_text:
How much did each team's top six draft picks play this week?

Also includes some notes about special teamers!

Data: #nflverse https://t.co/LS01z7zm77

bad play rate and explosive play rate for offenses for offenses in week 1

#nflverse https://t.co/7tIuUTMcKY

Here is a look at Ravens snaps from Week 1 by personnel. #nflverse
Special thanks to @reinhardNFL for help!
Extremely heavy personnel for Ravens. https://t.co/9AnHVUghA4

bad play rate and explosive play rate for offenses for offenses in week 1

#nflverse https://t.co/7tIuUTMcKY

Last year I developed the #nflverse {nflplotR} package and learned a lot about ggplot2 internals. While working on it I realized I could create robust geoms and theme elements that have nothing to do with nfl football. These fit better in a new, separate package. Thatâ€™s ggpath.

Through one week, #AFCNorth QBs struggled with accuracy (see negative values for CPOE on x-axis). Lamar, however, notably stood out with EPA per play due to positive plays both through the air and value added on the ground. #Steelers #nflverse https://t.co/3eR5GAdOqR

With Week 1 of the #NFL season done and dusted, here's how teams performed relative to where they left off last season.

Let the overreactions begin!

#nflverse https://t.co/8RY3CKyCkE

The @nfl returns tomorrow - and so it's time to introduce V3 of my forecasting model to the world!  I used @nflseedR to help me create 10k universes to explore the 2022 season.  Here are the average outcomes across all of the simulations.  

And a ðŸ§µ on the model #nflverse https://t.co/ThmHPB064X
And if you have any questions, comments, or desire to see my code (all in #rstats), let me know!  Thanks again to @LeeSharpeNFL @nflseedR and the entire #nflverse.  And let's go @steelers!

Inspired by one of my most favorite @FiveThirtyEight analyses (can't find it, but assuming it was @skepticalsports a few years ago), I recreated the analysis that shows that week one DOES have predictive power, along with every other record a team might have #nflverse #rstats https://t.co/Z989qVWm5j

The Rams, as has been reported already, only ever ran out 11 personnel (1 RB, 1 TE, 3 WR) on Thursday night, while the Bills put out 5 formations, though only two on a consistent basis. See follow up tweet for detailed explanation of formations. 

#nflverse #rstats #ggplot2 https://t.co/YERuHSsiHJ

Here's the defensive breakdown. These numbers are listed in LB, DL, DB order, so a 2-4-5 formation would be 2 LB, 4, DL, and 5 DB's on the field. For as little variation the Rams had on offense, they showed a ton more on defense. 

#nflverse #rstats #ggplot2 https://t.co/hkpVtohcSq

All my Chiefs fans, got something new for you today! Here's a snap count breakdown based on personnel formations. Some interesting notes: Gray is first TE when its 2 TE sets. Hardman is the WR when there's only 1 WR on the field. 

#nflverse #rstats https://t.co/5s0ZHL2ROU

In the span of one hour yesterday, there were *ten* game-winning or game-tying kicks attempted. This is the most kicks of this kind in a one-hour span in at least 20 years.

5 makes, 5 misses

Data: #nflverse https://t.co/P6sKUZNKn7

Something new that will hopefully be helpful for fantasy folks!

There is a dot on this graph for every RB snap in Week 1. Dots further to the left are in running situations, dots further to the right are in passing situations.

Data: #nflverse https://t.co/369rCZL0Mk

How much did each team's top six draft picks play this week?

Also includes some notes about special teamers!

Data: #nflverse https://t.co/LS01z7zm77
@CoopsFB working on it today, no eta #nflverse https://t.co/wEFuSw24uT
day one patching of #nflverse is in progress - load_pbp and load_player_stats are up and running now in all data repos, participation not there yet but ongoing. https://t.co/Z2Aof8Uo6e

NFL 2022 season starts today!
Let's see the draft round of the 53-man roster for each NFL team!

#nflverse #RStats #ggplot2 https://t.co/gmbHqpxGQl

Here is a look at Ravens snaps from Week 1 by personnel. #nflverse
Special thanks to @reinhardNFL for help!
Extremely heavy personnel for Ravens. https://t.co/9AnHVUghA4

bad play rate and explosive play rate for offenses for offenses in week 1

#nflverse https://t.co/7tIuUTMcKY

Last year I developed the #nflverse {nflplotR} package and learned a lot about ggplot2 internals. While working on it I realized I could create robust geoms and theme elements that have nothing to do with nfl football. These fit better in a new, separate package. Thatâ€™s ggpath.

Through one week, #AFCNorth QBs struggled with accuracy (see negative values for CPOE on x-axis). Lamar, however, notably stood out with EPA per play due to positive plays both through the air and value added on the ground. #Steelers #nflverse https://t.co/3eR5GAdOqR

With Week 1 of the #NFL season done and dusted, here's how teams performed relative to where they left off last season.

Let the overreactions begin!

#nflverse https://t.co/8RY3CKyCkE

The @nfl returns tomorrow - and so it's time to introduce V3 of my forecasting model to the world!  I used @nflseedR to help me create 10k universes to explore the 2022 season.  Here are the average outcomes across all of the simulations.  

And a ðŸ§µ on the model #nflverse https://t.co/ThmHPB064X
And if you have any questions, comments, or desire to see my code (all in #rstats), let me know!  Thanks again to @LeeSharpeNFL @nflseedR and the entire #nflverse.  And let's go @steelers!

Inspired by one of my most favorite @FiveThirtyEight analyses (can't find it, but assuming it was @skepticalsports a few years ago), I recreated the analysis that shows that week one DOES have predictive power, along with every other record a team might have #nflverse #rstats https://t.co/Z989qVWm5j

The Rams, as has been reported already, only ever ran out 11 personnel (1 RB, 1 TE, 3 WR) on Thursday night, while the Bills put out 5 formations, though only two on a consistent basis. See follow up tweet for detailed explanation of formations. 

#nflverse #rstats #ggplot2 https://t.co/YERuHSsiHJ

Here's the defensive breakdown. These numbers are listed in LB, DL, DB order, so a 2-4-5 formation would be 2 LB, 4, DL, and 5 DB's on the field. For as little variation the Rams had on offense, they showed a ton more on defense. 

#nflverse #rstats #ggplot2 https://t.co/hkpVtohcSq

All my Chiefs fans, got something new for you today! Here's a snap count breakdown based on personnel formations. Some interesting notes: Gray is first TE when its 2 TE sets. Hardman is the WR when there's only 1 WR on the field. 

#nflverse #rstats https://t.co/5s0ZHL2ROU

In the span of one hour yesterday, there were *ten* game-winning or game-tying kicks attempted. This is the most kicks of this kind in a one-hour span in at least 20 years.

5 makes, 5 misses

Data: #nflverse https://t.co/P6sKUZNKn7

Something new that will hopefully be helpful for fantasy folks!

There is a dot on this graph for every RB snap in Week 1. Dots further to the left are in running situations, dots further to the right are in passing situations.

Data: #nflverse https://t.co/369rCZL0Mk

The Rams, as has been reported already, only ever ran out 11 personnel (1 RB, 1 TE, 3 WR) on Thursday night, while the Bills put out 5 formations, though only two on a consistent basis. See follow up tweet for detailed explanation of formations.

Here's the defensive breakdown. These numbers are listed in LB, DL, DB order, so a 2-4-5 formation would be 2 LB, 4, DL, and 5 DB's on the field. For as little variation the Rams had on offense, they showed a ton more on defense.
